reviewText: A smart and important film that will leave you thinking about the water you drink, the community you live in, and what you can do to help the environment and others. Very interesting, disturbing, and thought provoking.

This movie is brilliant, informative, and moving. It flows well and is well done. Lots of inside information regarding the trials and tribulations of superfund sites and how they affect the families near them. It's a must see.

Brilliant, personal, and important film. Katie Damien is spot on with her depiction of a crisis that is probably more widespread than anyone wants to admit.
If you are an environmentally minded person, this is a film that you need to see!
